page.title: 13SIDBROOK-A SMALL DAIRY FARM.
page.content: Sidbrook Farm is a dairy farm of 111 acres.The main fields are: Park Meadow (8 acres),Yallands(15),Big Meadow(11), Pitlands(7.5), Goosen Ford(6), Small Blackpits(9),Big Blackpits(13),Castle Meadow(11.5),Six Acres(6),Front Field (3.5), Clarkes Field(3).There is also the farmyard and two old orchards. The farm has been in the family since 1912, and the present farmer has run it since 1949.He has one farm hand to help him.There are 62 Friesian cows in the herd,all but one of these having been bred on the farm. The cows are fed on grass, cow cake, hay, silage, kale and fodder. To provide winter food for the cows hay and silage are made.The hay is made in June and in 1985 the farm was expecting 2500 bales.Silage is made from May 15th onwards and takes two weeks to make.
